title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Refineries Modernization and Petroleum Ports Development, through National US Arab Chamber Of Commerce (Inc)

description.narrative: The Refineries Modernization and Petroleum Ports Development Reverse Trade Mission ("RTM") Series consists of two separate and distinct RTMs designed to showcase advanced U.S. technology solutions to support the modernization of Egypt's oil and gas sector. Specifically, the objective of this RTM series is to offer commercial opportunities for a wide range of U.S. equipment and services related to refineries modernization and petroleum ports development in Egypt.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Enjaz Integrated Petrochemical Complex Project, through Fluor Corporation

description.narrative: This grant will partially fund a feasibility study (FS) to evaluate the technical and economic feasibility of the Enjaz Integrated Petrochemical Complex Project to be located in the Suez Governorate in the Sokhna area in the Suez Canal Economical Zone (SE Zone). The FS will evaluate developing a petrochemical complex that would utilize natural gas from the newly discovered Zohr gas fields.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Ministry of Petroleum Reverse Trade Mission Series, through Koeppen, Elliot & Associates, Ltd.

description.narrative: The Egypt Ministry of Petroleum Reverse Trade Mission ("RTM") Series consists of three separate and distinct RTMs designed to showcase advanced U.S. technology solutions to support the modernization of Egypt's oil and gas sector. Specifically, the objective of this RTM series is to familiarize Egyptian officials with commercial opportunities for a wide range of U.S. equipment and services related to advanced onshore exploration and production technology, energy efficiency, and safety.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Ministry of Petroleum Oil & Gas Sector Executive Management and Leadership, through National US Arab Chamber Of Commerce (Inc)

description.narrative: The Egyptian Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Resources (MoP) Executive Training Program RTM ("RTM") consists of a visit to Houston, TX and Washington, DC for executives of the MoP. The delegates will receive training designed to support the modernization of Egypt's oil and gas sector and to promote U.S. company relationships within the sector. The objective of this RTM is to provide senior MoP leaders with energy-sector specific executive leadership training prior to beginning secondments with individual U.S. petroleum companies that would begin at a later date following their return to Egypt.

description.narrative: USTDA is funding this Feasibility Study ("FS") to support the Egyptian Petrochemicals Holding Company ("EChem") in developing a polyoxymethylene (POM) petrochemicals plant. This FS would provide a domestic supply of an engineering plastic which could be used in many industrial and consumer products.

title.narrative: Ministry of Petroleum Oil & Gas Sector Exec Management and Leadership Training, through Global Marketing & Communications, Inc.

description.narrative: The Egyptian Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Resources (MoP) Executive Training Program: Phase II consists of a series of three delegation visits to Houston, TX and Washington, DC for senior executives and fast-track midlevel career employees of the MoP. The delegates will receive training designed to support the modernization of Egypts oil and gas sector and to promote U.S. company relationships within the sector. A key objective of this Training Program is to provide senior MoP leaders with energy-sector specific executive leadership training prior to some of the delegates beginning secondments with individual U.S. petroleum companies.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Suez Oil Processing Company Reformer Complex Upgrade Feasibility Study, through Honeywell International, Inc.

description.narrative: This grant funds a feasibility study for the Suez Oil Processing Company (SOPC), a subsidiary of the state-owned Egyptian General Petroleum Corporation (EGPC). This feasibility study will help SOPC determine the feasibility of deploying a new reforming process for its refinery and to revamp existing equipment. This will allow EGPC to increase gasoline production using existing SOPC assets in order to better meet the energy needs of the domestic Egyptian market.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Citrus Process and Production Facility, through Government of Egypt

description.narrative: This $503,000 feasibility study (FS) for Hama for Food Industries (HAMA) is supporting the expansion of their citrus processing and packing facilities. This FS is recommending improvements to a planned two-phased expansion plan that will implement four high capacity citrus sorting, grading, and packing processing lines; cold storage technology and equipment; and juicing and corrugated carton operations.

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Port Automation Reverse Trade Mission, through Agland Investment Services, Inc.

description.narrative: The Port Automation Reverse Trade Mission (RTM) introduced public and private stakeholders from Egypt to U.S. port automation technologies and services such as those related to transport and trucking management; inspection; container and warehouse; and river port handling and synchronization. In addition to serving as an excellent opportunity to showcase U.S. technologies and services throughout the intermodal value chain, this RTM supported a pillar of the U.S. Governments economic assistance approach with Egypt.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Pharmaceutical Supply Chain, through Government of Egypt

description.narrative: This $557,704 grant is providing a feasibility study to examine the pharmaceutical supply chain in Egypt. The study includes an analysis of the current pharmaceutical supply process and is designing a pilot project in two chosen governorates. Implementation of the project is expected to lead to a reduction in pharmaceutical expenditure and will improve the quality of service offered to patients using the public health system in Egypt.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Raya Holding Data Center and Cloud Services, through Government of Egypt

description.narrative: This $285,804 grant supports a feasibility study (FS) for the Egyptian private sector company Raya Holding to support a new 1,000 m2 data center with cloud computing services in Egypt. The objective of the Raya Holding Data Center and Cloud Services FS is to enable Raya Holding to implement a new data center that offers the scalability, security, and reliability that are necessary to meet the demanding requirements of enterprises and governments in Egypt, the Middle East, and Africa.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - POSITIVE TRAIN CONTROL SYSTEM, through Government of Egypt

description.narrative: USTDA is providing a $658,323 grant to the Ministry of Transport to fund a Feasibility Study (FS) for a PTC system for Egyptian National Railways (ENR). The FS includes a comprehensive evaluation of PTC system goods, service and technologies for use on the Egyptian railways and prepares ENR to procure a PTC pilot project. In addition, the study provides a scope and economic assessment for a full implementation of PTC on the ENR network.

The FS defines the design and infrastructure requirements for a naphtha cracker in Egypt to produce propylene and ethylene. KBR, Inc. is the sole source contractor for this project.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Cairo International Airport ICT Modernization Technical Assistance, through Government of Egypt

description.narrative: This $622,225 technical assistance (TA) grant supports ICT Modernization at the Cairo International Airport in Egypt. The objective of the TA is to provide a blueprint to guide the acquisition of ICT infrastructure and the implementation of an integrated airport ICT system, capable of managing existing and future information technology needs at the Cairo International Airport. The TA supports national economic development goals and would serve as the catalyst to strengthen and promote U.S. business opportunities in the aviation market in Egypt.
